title: Bug 13196[Browsing] Consequences of changes
OB: When there is an open editor, all manipulations should work on the working copy shown in the editor.
EB: Then both manipulations behave the same. If there is an open editor, all manipulations should just work on the working copy shown in the editor.
SR:
From the user's perspective, there is an unexpected behavioral difference when manipulating the source in the type hierarchy and in the method list of the browser perspective. 

Steps to reproduce:
1) Open Java Browsing Perspective
2) Select a type
3) Select a method in the method list view
4) Delete the method from the context menu of the method list view
   - Expected result: The editor becomes dirty
5) Select another type
6) Open type hierarchy on this type and dock the hierarchy view
7) Select a method in the method list view
8) Select the same method in the hierarchy view
9) Delete the method from the context menu of the hierarchy view
   - Expected result: The method should be deleted only on the file system, but the type list view, method list view, and editor should remain unaffected.

Note: This is not the case when the editor is dirty.
